page.title: 03ECOLOGY - GENERAL
page.content: The area has an interesting variety of wild flowers, birds and animals and a public interest in their welfare. A system of footpaths radiates from Skelton across the farmland. Much conservation work has been done eg. the ponds near Roadends Wood and the school grounds, tree planting in Braisgate, at Ellonby, in the hedge- rows and around the school. In contrast the occasional hedgerow is lost under the farmer's plough. The climate is healthy and varied with winter midday temperature of 4c rising to 17c in summer. Skelton is generally known for its cool strong winds. Snowdrifts may cut off the villages in winter whilst heatwaves MAY occur in the summer.
